line.text: Some say thy fault is youth some wantonness
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Some say thy grace is youth and gentle sport
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Both grace and faults are loved of more and less
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Thou mak faults graces that to thee resort
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As on the finger of a throned queen
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The basest jewel will be well esteemed
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So are those errors that in thee are seen
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: To truths translated and for true things deemed
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: How many lambs might the stern wolf betray
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If like a lamb he could his looks translate
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: How many gazers mightst thou lead away
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: if thou wouldst use the strength of all thy state
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But do not so I love thee in such sort
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As thou being mine mine is thy good report
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
